112.content:
You live in a little town named Gullyton. It is a peaceful town near the sea, with good connections to other nearby towns and villages and you are rarly short of supplies.
But the Travelers who get the supplies, who venture past the town's walls...

Gullyton has a serious problem, GIANTS, which is Ok if you're Macrophilic, like yourself, but it is still a great problem, it makes the Werewolf attacks of '62 look delightful. You must get a Giants rade once a fortnight. Men, Women, Teenagers, all taken without Prejudice. No-one knows what happens to these innocent people, but everyone has their own views:
'Me 'usband, 'pon the stormy night!' Mrs O'Hara would cry 'taken, taken f'r fodder, gone wit' te wind!'
'All o' my cattle went one day,' was Mr Leary's comment 'probably used f'r some saddistic games an' wotnot'
'And the took my wife,' Count DeNumbers said, 'So pretty, probably used as a mate'
The stories went on, you could only pray that the last account was the truest.

One day you were sitting on the big rock overlooking the cliffs and the sea. You turned you head and spotted...
...Oh god!... a giant!

It must have been 50ft tall and wore nothing but strips of cloth over itself.
It appeared to be a woman as it had such a large chest.
She had long tangeled hair, a very nice figure, and a largeish bum. the cloth only covered her chest and what was covering her lower region only realy looked like a big leaf. Although she looked like Monster Girl of the century, something about her rough-and-tumbleness made her appeare kinda... sexy.

You where too horrifide to move, you just sat there, staring. she didn't notice you though and walked right up to you, turned around, sat on you.
112.title: Monster Girl of the Century (but still kinda sexy)

choices: Start on the side of Leviathan
Start on the side of Luctan
121.content:
Our story starts on the Planet of Yaffsafar. The Planet has just one big Kontinent which in devidied into two countries. The country of Luctan, and the country of Leviathan.

The countries differ in one major point: Luctans people are 72x smaller than their neighbors. This is not just for the people. Also the flora and faune and the complete nature is the same size.

The legend says that 10.000 Years ago there was a great war between the Luctans and the Leviathans. Obvious the Luctans couldn't stand a chance since everything they stood against the leviathans was literally crushed underfoot. The great magicians of the four kingdoms united to finaly drive back the giants to their side of the Kontinent. Then they put up a great magical barrier that had cost the life of all four of the great magicians. No, that nobody ruled the Kingdoms anymore all hell broke lose and the Kingdomship broke apart. Now Luctan was reigned by Warlords who owned the cities. with the time the warlords became Kings and new borders where drawn. War, peace and diplomacy led to a new Luctan. It was now divided into 8 parts, ruled by their kings. The barrier became a Legend since nobody went near this sacred place till then. The knowledge of "higher magic" and the barrier was lost and became finaly nothing more than a legend.


Another Legend says that the people of Leviathan where cursed by the gods for crossing the holy border to the other world and causing so much chaos, that the gods have taken them the abbillitie of evolution and they even took one of their genders. The Leviathans just consists of women.

2000 years after the great war, the scale started to tilt. The barrier is losing power and it is just a matter of time till it collapses.

This day is today!
121.title: The great barrier

choices: Run back to the village to report what you just saw

1211.content:
You are Rahja, a 17 year old teenager from the village of Leth. You just went into the woods to gather some berries for your village. You knew the Woods almost perfectly, up to the place of the sacred light where nobody goes.

The legend sayed that the light prevents us from getting into the Land of prosperity and wisdom. Nobody can touch the light. After a while his body starts to hurt and seconds later you simply start to boil and finaly burn to death.

You are a very pretty girl even if it is for no use for you. You just wear a piece of leather in front of your lower private section and some sandals. The rest of your body is completly naked. You have silky black hair and big, exotic green eyes. Your skin was of a bronze tan because of the enduring sunshine on the continent. You are of an athletic figure, but that is normal for everyone in the village because of the bodyworks the whole day on the outside, but your muscles are just very sligtly visible.

You just looked at the barrier and think what would be behind it as you already turn around and wanted to go for a nearby Blogberrybush. You just wanted to take a look back at the sacred object, as suddenly you looked into a whole new world. It looked like there was a giant modellandscape in front of her, just two steps beneath you. The barrier was gone.
1211.title: The barrier

You didn't knew what to do. This is a situation that hasn't occured since about 10.000 years refered to the great legend. It was a great shock for you and it was more a reflex than a thought that you started to run towards your village.

Completly exhausted you stand in front of the pallisad trench of your village and for the first time since you made the discovery you could find a clear thought, so where do you go?

12112.content:
Like in trance you go towards the new world. You reach the edge of the small cliff and look down. It was really a toyworld. Little mountains, little trees and bushes you even saw some little goats jumping around. Without any other thought you climbed down the cliff towards the new land.

You feet sunk in a little bit as you settled your weight on it. This was mainly rocky terrain, but you saw some nice green areas a few meters to the east. You think that that was shining on the ground over there could be a village or something like that. In excitment you start to move.
12112.title: One little step...

choices: Try to make contact with the tiny people
121121.content:
After a while you reach the green grass. Your feet sunk into the ground as if it was mud. You leave clear brown footprints on the ground. Your sandals protects your feet from the trees which could sting your sole. When you step on the tiny trees with your sandals on, they just squash flat and become a brown paste in a footprint, like everything else.

Then you see a field of wheat and a farm. You have never seen a farm before since your folk don't grow corpses. And this farm was so tiny. The house just went up to her ankle. She was excited about how big she was to the world on this side of the barrier.

this is the land of the prophecy, of the legend. You now have the chance to continue the war against the puny little civilisation on this side of the continent or you could try to contact them.
121121.title: First contact

choices: reach inside to grab all the family
1211211.content: Rahja went down to her hands and knees to look down into the small house. As she looked, her eyes grew wide with surprise when she saw a tiny family inside, there was a man about 45 years old, a woman in her late 30's, two boys about her own age and a little girl. She also noticed that besides the size difference, there were also a few differences between her own people and them. While her people were white but tan skinned and dark haired "sort of a latin look", these small people inside the farm were very pale and had blond or red hair. Rahja had never seen people like that before and she found them to be extremely attractive.
1211211.title: little house

12112111.content:
carefully she tucked her hands into the soft earth around the house and lifted it up together with its surroundings.

Rahja could hold the house and parts of its ground in one hand. It wasn't even that heavy. Maybe a small rock or something but she still couldn't believe thatshe was holding a house in her hand.

With a quick movement she ripped away the straw roof and peeped inside the house. The Family was covering in a corner. They seemed to be scared to death. Who could blame them? Everything inside was upside down and tumbled to the ground. The girl simply put the complete house upside down and poured everything inside onto the palm of her other hand. She simply dropped the empty house onto the floor about 320 ft below. It landed there with a crash and left a small dustcloud next to her toe. Then she turned her attention towards the furniture and the living beeings of the house in her hand.
12112111.title: forced out

121121111.content:
Rahja couldn't believe that this was the ancient enemy! She's trained since girlhood to be wary of their tricks and to stomp on anything small, but these bugs seemed pathetic! She reached for one (the father, though she couldn't tell) and frowned in disgust as 'it' squashed between her clumsy fingers. Worthless!
The other two clung to each other and Rahja felt an urge to hurt them. They were so weak, they disgusted her! She was angry and wanted to not just squish them (which would be easy) but make them suffer, before she and her sisters crushed all of these sickening little mites into grease!

She could see their nest not far away and yearned to crush it, but what to do with these?
121121111.title: The sadistic goddess

121121112.content:
Rahja stared down at the family in the palm of her hand "they look so afraid" she though and a gentle smile formed in her face and then said in her best soothing voice "Don't be afraid little ones, I'm not going to hurt you"

then she sat on the ground and set the family in her lap. At that moment the youngest in the family, a girl of some three years old began to cry. "Aww, don't cry sweety. I promise that no harm wil come to you or your people"
The oldest boy, a blond haired boy who was about rahja's age, finally spoke "Y..you speak our leanguage?? did you come from the great barrier??"

Rahja looked at him "God, he is so handsome"
121121112.title: meeting them

1211211122.content: "Well I don't know cutey," she said as she plucked him up between her index finger and thumb. She pulled him up to her face to look at him closer. She closely examined as he slightly swayed. "Put me down!" he shouted. She replied with a simple "Make me," and then...
1211211122.title: Rahja answers

1211212.content:
The fields of corpse didn't even felt different as your sandal sunk into the ground. You looked down to the house while walking and without a care in the world you stepped on it as if it was an unpopulary, old toy. You heard the cracking of the bursting wood as your foot touched the roof and pressed it down. It was not much more resistance than the trees and you don't even had to apply additional pressure to your foot. As you looked back, there was a footprint as similar as the other ones. A few splinters in different colors showed, that there was something before the mighty foot touched down.

You never felt so mighty in your life before. you was a goddess amongst insects now and nobody could stop you. You decided to bring the war back to this puny little world and this time your folk will win and take revange for the punishments they had to take.
1211212.title: Decleration of WAR!

choices: Stay with Rahja's point of view
Switch to the villager's point of view
12112121.content:
The villagers saw Rahja coming a mile away. There was little time to prepare though. They had had no way of knowing how perilously close they were to the barrier. They were but poor peasants and in any case a pitifully small number of steps brought the immense savage girl to their homes.
Rahja's face fixed into sneer as she surveyed the village of the enemy. They were nothing! How dare these bugs challenge the might of her warrior tribe! She would crush them underfoot and return home to a hero's feast!
She roared in defiance and stomped across the tiny fields into the settlement. It was small, a cluster of huts made of little plants and mud lower than her ankle. Dozens of people no higher than an inch ran about her sandalled feet. She raised her foot high above a large hut and stamped down with all her might, grunting with exhertion. It crunched without resistance and for the tiny people the earth shook. Other huts collapsed and little ones were knocked down by the power of her strong leg.
The had offered so little resistance to the soft leather sole of her sandal that she'd barely felt the twigs snap and it was pressed so far into the ground that earth fell in on to her toes.
Then she heard a horrible noise. A high pitched squealing coming from around her feet. The little ones! They were moving slowly away from her wriggling toes. Some just lay still. There were lots that were even smaller than an inch. They thought they could escape!
Rahja stomped a few more huts, careless of wether any were hiding inside and then stood, hands on her shapely hips and laughed down at her routing enemies.
"Cowards! You scurry like the bugs you are! But I, Rahja of the Tribe of Titania will show you the fate of cowards. She stretched her long toned leg over the heads of some of the fleeing crowds and trod down with a loud crunch on the woods they had been running to. Another step and she was ahead of them. It didn't matter that some had run in the other way as it would take only seconds to walk around to them.
She raised her left foot above the squeaking mob and moved it above the most little ones she could. "Praise Titania for my strong legs and warrior's feet" she thought as she stepped on five little ones. They crunched moistly under her sole and she raised her heel twisting her toes to grind them into the dirt. Tilana back at the village would not have been able to get so many in one step with her tiny foot!
But there were still some sixty runts left to deal with and Rahja swore to let none escape justice, so she set to work circling the village, herding them to the few surviving huts, and relishing the crunching of each heavy footstep.
12112121.title: Warrior woman

choices: Rahja takes them for a snack on the way back home
Just crush em like the rest
121121211.content:
Rahja looked down at the rest of the tiny villagers below. Most of the remaining villagers began taking refuge inside of their huts while others continued to flee away from the great woman. There was no way she was going to allow any one of them to escape for what they did. Rahja then lifted her giant sandal clad foot and slammed it down on the group of ten fleeing villagers.
Seven of them were actually flattened underneath the leather sole while the remaining three just barely missed Rahja's huge foot by a few inches. She gritted her teeth as she grinded them into the earth, wiggling her massive toes. Just then the ground beneath the three recovering villagers beside Rahja's foot started to cave in as Rahja's sandal sank into the dirt. Two of the tiny villagers managed to get away, but one of them lost his footing and fell back onto the huge, field sized insole of Rahja's sandal. He only had a few feet of space between him and the massive ball of flesh that was Rahja's heel. Before he could even scream, The huge heel came down, setteling back down into its rightful place and crushing the man into nothing. Rahja continued to wipe out the remaining huts and villagers inside with her feet. Twisting them into a digusting mixture of mud,grass and flesh. Sometimes she'd even kick the small houses with her feet, sending debri and tiny people hurling to their doom. As Rahja approaches the last standing hut, the five only remaining villagers came out and began trying to escape. Rahja laughed. They had nowhere else to go or hide at now. Rahja approached them and began deciding what their final fate should be
121121211.title: Rahja's power

choices: Tomorrow: the giants return in force
1211212112.content:
As Rahja stomped the last hut flat she laughed at the stupidity of the little ones. They were all running in the same direction, as if to make it easier for her to squash them! One step forward brought her within striking distance. Two half inch high squeelers were knock down by the force of her footfall and a third inch high actually started to run back!
Marvelling at that such human looking creatures should show no more sense than common bugs Rahja shifted the front of her sandle so that her toes covered all three and carried on walking. The leather of her sandle bulged under her toes, then as her weight shifted forward onto them, her other foot raising above the last two insects she felt the soft crunch as her toes splayed out.
There was one holding a tinier one just standing facing Rahja's twisting toes and making that high pitched squealing.
Rahja planted her foot next to the vanquished foes and put her hands back on her hips as she laughed down at them.
"You bugs thought you could challenge Leviathan?" She laughed again. "This land is ours by right of power. Tommorrow I shall return with my sisters and we will walk upon this whole land from end to end. VICTORY!"
While talking Rahja had dipped the toe of her right sandle behind the last two Luctans so that they were under her heel. As she cried victory she pressed her heel down and raising her toes twisted it into the dirt.
That was the last of them. She tilted her left foot back and noted a couple of squashed creatures stuck to her sole. Rahja surveyed her handywork. Where once had been a tiny village was simply a small clearing covered in her own footprints and scuff marks. There were still tiny piles of earth and broken twigs, semi crushed little bodies and tiny things. Just to make sure she methodically paced up and down firmly treading on every inch of ground, feeling the odd crunch or squelch as already crushed bodies were further mashed into pulp beneath her heavy tread.
Satisfied at a job well done, the warrior girl set off happily for home anticipating the hero's reception ahead.
1211212112.title: Victory

choices: Shia goes south to spread the word
12112121121.content:
Shia rode back into the town of Wood and hurridly stabled her horse, Cotton. Wood. It was called so because it’s main business was lumber from the forests on this this side of Mt. Snemobil. It may seem like a silly name to some, but to Shia, it was lovable, rather than stupid. It meant home. It was all she had ever known.

She had been out riding and had gone around the north-east face towards, the hinterlands. It had started as a normal day, but then she had seen the giantess... A figure like a woman but nearly five hundred feet high towering over the trees in the far distance. She hadn’t ridden to check the village which lay in that way, but, scared, had turned to ride home. She knew the old stories... Some parents still scared their children with tales of the old days when the Terrible Ones would kill people by the thousand, first eating and then just crushing en masse. Of how only the sorceror, Mur Aul had saved them with desperate magic.

It was almost sunset, and Brian, the Innkeeper’s son had been waiting for her.

“No time...!” she said as she walked along with him following close behind.

“What’s wrong, Shia?” She tried to explain as they headed for the Wood Tower of Books.

The tower belonged to to Seletor, and acted as both his home, and a public library. Outside, his maid, Dorothy was pruning his roses.

“Mornin’” she said as Shia walked past and rapped the door. Seletor let them in and seated around in his study with some rather rough fortified wine, the young girl related her story to the increasingly grave old man. “I could see most of her in the distance over the trees. I couldn’t see what she was doing, but she was moving a little and looking down... I didn’t hang around....”

The discussion was long and seemed surreal to Brian. Fairytales come to life!

“There are several things to attend to,” said Seletar, “One group must go south and raise the alarm. The king must know what transpires. Word must spread.
“The other group must go north east and their mission will be twofold. They must accertain what happened there and contact the village of Farndale. Then they must head into the land of the Giantess’ itself ....” Shia’s eyes widened. “To make contact."
12112121121.title: "I saw a giantess!"

12112121122.content:
Rhaja rushed back to the village. As soon as she climbed up the cliff, she was in her usual world again. She had to get used to the sight of the trees beeing bigger than herself.

At first nobody believed the story Rhaja had to tell but soon enough scouts cofirmed the vanishing of the Great Barrier. Since it was dark now the exploration had to wait, but tomorrow morning 7000 of Leviathans Amazon Soldiers will conquer the hated land of Luctan.

This night would be the night Leviathan celebrates its victory over the minimen although most of them havn't even touched the ground of them. It was a great party and word spread fast so Leviathan was a great Party.
12112121122.title: The night before the battle

121121211221.content:
In the early morninghours more than 10000 Amazones walked through the woods. Most of them where naked or had just a piece of leather or fur in front of their private parts. Some had sandals or boots and some where just walking on their bare feets. The nice climate and the hard work made all of them look more or less beautiful. All of them where very excited and just waited for the signal to move into the new land.

The people of Luctan could already hear the sounds of the giants behind the cliff but they could do nothing but wait. Some decided to flee and some just hid in their buildings. Some brave warriors tried to form an army although it was no use. The message about the village the giantess had leveled to the ground had spread fast. But It was also a message to say that Luctan won't go without a fight! Then it was silent.

Everyone silenced just before the signal came. Then the tousands of women walked through the woods and down the cliff. More and more came down and as the first women stepped on the first field of the first village, there where still warriors to come. Within seconds the ground beneath the giant feet away and the green grasses and healthy woods (most of them not even reached the middle of the shin) became nothing more than mud.
121121211221.title: The next morning

1211212112211.content: The tiny little Luctans looked up in terror as the huge Leviathans began to stomp their way into the tiny village! You come out of your hutt and see the vast number of enourmous female warriors approaching the village. You can only helplessly watch as a huge leather Sandal clad foot comes down on Ten of the other hutts. Villagers begin screaming and fleeing from their homes as the huge feet of the giantesses begin grinding the tiny hutts and smashing little people into the earth. Each step would claim about thirty lives. Sometimes more or less. Some of the giantesses bend down and scoop up about 8-10 fleeing villagers in their palms and devour them by the handfull. The sounds of flesh tearing and bones breaking between their powerful teeth is just dreadful. Suddenly something important crosses your mind. Your wife and daughter! Last time you heard from them they said they were going shopping into town for more fruits and meat for dinner! Panicking, you begin to fight your way thru the oncoming crowds of other Luctans while praying that they are still safe and havent become just the many other lives of Luctans claimed by the Leviathans! When you arrive into town...
1211212112211.title: The attack starts

12112121122111.content:
People where running like mad. Behind them there where three Leviathans who just giggled and stomped their feet on the ground. They where young. Maybe between 16 and 20. You watch in terror as the Enourmous Feet lift into the air and came crushing down with an mindwrecking noise. Even if their feet are on the ground you still could see shortly below their ankles even behind the houses. "MARIE, AMELIE!", you scream while fighting your way through the stream of fleeing people.

From your left you hear a voice "DADDY, WE ARE HERE" You look there and see Marie your daughter together with your wife. They where just shortly in front of the fountain which was still working.

You expression turned from relief to terror as you saw the impact of a Giant sandleheel behind your family. You could see up the sole which was dirty and gritty from the mud the girls walked in. Slowly it descended. Debris where falling from the treads and some people where hit and died because of the impact or got trampled by the panicked mob. A house slowly crumbled as the sole touched it but still went downwards unstoppably. "OH LORD! RUN, RUN!" You scream as you see that the sole was just a few feet away from the heads of your family. Behind them everything was dozed down like gust. You cried as you understood that they would not make it in any case. "DAddy!", Marie screamed as the sole knocked her down. Then her screams where replaced by the sound of cracking cracking bones and tearing flesh.

The foot roled over the poor people in the city since the giantess was walking and they where crushed just casually. You sank to your knees as the foot lifted again and the shadow of doom fell over you. You look high up into the air to see the leather sole blocking out the sun.
12112121122111.title: Drama

121121211221111.content:
It's over. There's nothing left. They are gone, and all around you everyone you ever known is perishing. A giant bare foot treads down near you covering a dozen people.... Natalia, a childhood friend, and her husband and children... old Bran the baker, buildings. Above the leather sole smeared with your family and friends descends and it's...


Far overhead three young girls play happily. One is naked but for soft leather sandals and the others wear scraps of cloth but are barefoot. They aren't real warriors, little more than children, but they know what to do. They giggle and joke as they try to stomp on as many little ones as they can with each step. They laugh at the funny squealing noise they make and bulldoze tiny houses with their toes. They dance on them and sing and giggle. And when the whole town is just a lifeless field of footprints they move on.

There's a bigger nest on the horizon and the day is young.
121121211221111.title: Death from above

The goal was to claim the caslte of Luctan - The legendary place where the barrier was created and the ruler of Luctan, King Morano lived. The women marched on in a perfect square formation 100x100 with little space inbetween them. This was the most effective way to make their way through the hostile territory. They could reach their destination within this day. Luctan was small...

They soon reached the village that had been destroyed the day before. without hesitation the soldiers trampled down everything in their path without even caring and walked on. They complete way was a trail of destruction and every luctan that saw their horizon filling with the giant army simply stood there in horror until one of them smashed him beneath her. Soon they reached the first big city
1211212112212.title: View leviathan

They had spotted the Luctan army some time ago but now they where just a few meters away. Some men where fleeing already from terror as the massive wall of giant females came towards them. The line filled almost the whole horizon and the wall went further than the city.

The Leviathan' Amazones didn't even bother to stop as they simply walked away over the army. The last Luctan warrior died somewhere beneath the feet of a Women in the 8th of 100 rows. As the 10.000 Women past the city and every remains of its existance was gone.

choices: There is really only one true choice you must crush these tiny worms, dispaly yo
No, you must make serve as an example for your people to follow. You could learn
121122.content:
(note to readers:I tried to use a few words and phrases I believe a barbaric people might, I hope this is perceived as a plus and not a detriment. Anyhoo read and at end I'll define the words i made up for this.)
As you hurriedly approach the teensy village, you hear a shrill sound with your ears; made keen by years of hunting. It seems to be coming from the ground. Your emerald eyes shoot down instinctively. There, a finger-measure in front of your feet lies a Smallstuff tribe of warriors,armed with slashers and stabsticks,and dressed in shiny rock-skin.You stifle a giggle as it builds in your chest.A few brave ones bear the gleaming weapons aggresively, but most are shaking nervously and'or choking in the dust you've been kicking up in your rush. One, the chief, you assume, seems to be attempting to speak to you. His arms are waving his slasher at you.After some intense concentration you are able to hear some of what he's shouting."stop now,barbarous giant! turn back and leave our village in peace or thou shalt face the fury of nine hells or I am not Sir Roland the Purefleece!" His tribe mates still cower behind him.Their fear fills you with a feeling of might and pride. The Smallstuffs beat your people in the Great Many-battle. If you were to single-handedly crush their puny kingdoms you would gain much praise and spoils from the rest of your tribe. Then again, a small part of you says (ever quietly), it may be a time for a new age of peace between the Leviathan and the Smallstuffs. Your pouty lips curl into a smile as you decide what to do:
(and now as promised:finger-measure=the length of the pointer finger. Smallstuffs= The Leviathan word for the Luctens. slashers=swords. stabsticks=spears. rock-skin=armor. Many-battle=war.)
121122.title: The welcoming Commitee?

choices: You're kinda hungry, and even rockskin is no problem for your mighty molars.
Crush the cowards in your fists and use their blood as warpaint.
1211221.content: Your smile widens. You've made your choice and you believe your tribe would be proud. You swing your sandled foot directly into Sir Roland and, due to its massive size, several of his men. They fly a few footmeasures and land with a disastrous crash. Most who survive attempt to flee, thier morale in shambles, but about six brave your might and try to stab, poke and cut at you. If they break your thick skin, you don't feel it. You swiftly bring your feet down upon them uncaringly. You are rewdarded with satisfying crunches as their feeble bones crack and compact beneath your gargantuan tread. You feel delightfully invincible.Blood drips from your leather sole as you bear down upon the abandoners. They are scared, frantic and clumsy in their heavy(to them, of course)rockskin, so it doesn't take you long to catch them. The fall upon each other and scream and swipe at the air with their tiny Smallstuff weapons in terror as your shadow cools them.You bring your hands down and scoop them up. As you bring them before your beaming face, a few fall or jump to their doom, splattering on the ground below you. Those remaing throw down thier weapons in surrender. A strong feeling of sadistic glee fills you as you mill over what to do with the weaklings.
1211221.title: DYING TIME IS HERE!!!

switch our POV to that of a Smallstuff of your choice. Whoo! Democracy!
12112211.content: Your flat tummy growls viciously, and makes up your mind for you. You moisten your lips and watch as several of the men in your palms wet themselves. Not one to eat too daintily you simply lift both handfulls of "warriors" above you and drop the dozen or so into your open mouth. Most make it in, but a few pummet down and bounce off of your perky breasts and bounce to crunching deaths. You find Sir Thomas at the village Inn and blurt out the news. By this time the titaness is plain for all too see and approaching rapidly, so he does not doubt your words. You have never seen the old knight look so grave as he does now. And is that a hint of fear in his eyes? You would never have believed it. But then you also doubted the old legends.
"My lord, what are we to do?" You ask.
Thomas downs his ale in one and fixes you with a steely glare. "There is nothing we can do. Not by force of arms. In times of old, these giants were driven back only by desperate magick and we have no such thing at our disposal. Our fate lies in her hands.”
You can’t believe what you’re hearing!
“There must be something we can do!”
The old knight sighs, “Our only way forward is to try to communicate with the titaness. The legends say that they speak a similar tongue to our own.”
Clad in chainmail, his sword by his side, Sir Thomas rises from his seat and walks for the doorway. You can now hear the rumble of the giantess’ approach and the others in the inn are looking apprehensive. Sally, the innkeeper’s daughter looks at your imploringly. “Jeremiah, the giantess will not harm us will she? We are peaceful. She won’t harm us?”
You’ve become fond of this flaxen haired girl since you came to this town and can’t bare the thought of her being in danger.

The girl laughed as she trod on the tiny man. Less than an inch high she barely felt him crunch through her shoe sole. She walked on and ten minutes later she had completely forgotten about the encounter....
This is not Earth.
This is a world called by it's inhabitants Teralax. It's a world both like and unlike our own. This story takes place in a country called Lucitania. It's culture and technology is much like that of early 21st century England, but this is not Earth, nor is this England. This world is recivering from a dark age, much as our own is, but in this case the rise and fall of technology was far more drastic. Three thouand years ago, technology and science had advanced to a level far beyond the level of the present day.
The study of genetics produced many strange creatures, few of which have survived to the present day. With the success of this Utopian society came overpopulation. People were living longer and unwilling to forego children. Society faced disaster as resources seemed destined to run out. Genetic science seemed to hold the key to salvation.
Rather than fathering children normally, children would be engineered by combining the genetic material of the parents. Also these children would be smaller. Much smaller. Eventually, when the older generation died out, the human race would all be less than an inch tall and would never have to worry about starvation or poverty again.
Of course, to some, this plan seemed insane, and many refused to take part in the programme, to the disgust of the billions who did. The programme continued anyway. At first, the tiny children were cared for by their parents, but as they grew up, many chose to move to their own miniture towns.
Then came the plague.
It was a mistake. A mistake which became a genetic disaster. A virus created in a lab experiment was accidently realeased into the air. The virus was deadly, airborne, and seemingly unstoppable. Across the world people died in their millions. But, as with many viruses, particuarly those borne in the lab, the plague prayed on certain people with certain genetic traits. It barely touched the new inch high population. It struck at the 'traditionalist humans'. And though only about 70% of women were killed, it infected 100% of men. None survived.
In our society, such a thing would mean the end of the species, but not here. They still had the technology which had artificially combined DNA to create tiny people. Now, it was used by the surviving traditionalists to combine the DNA of female partners and create full sized female offspring. There was no point in creating boys, as they would become infected and die within hours of birth, and it was likely that the virus would never go away. It lived benignly in all females. Mankind (normal sized) was dead, but by the miracle of technology, womankind survived.
Then came the Age of Chaos. The sudden death of 85% of the traditionalist population which still covered the majority of the planet could not go without effect. Civilisation collapsed entirely and the rule of the sword became normality. Cities were abandoned, full of the dead. Everything was ruined in the space of a year. What followed was a dark age lasting over a thousand years. Almost all science culture and knowledge was lost. Only the vital reproductive tech survived as the centre of various new world religions.
Eventually, culture, science and civilisation recovered. At least it mostly recovered. History was a blank slate, there were no men.... and knowledge of the true nature of the tiny people had been forgotten. This was the greatest tragedy of all.
When law and order broke down, the people who called themselves the Alieth had no protection from the barbaric giants. A thousand years later and they still don't. To the modern woman of Teralax, these tiny people aren't people at all; merely insects who oddly mimic human shape. And they think nothing of killing them en masse.
After a thousand years spent hiding and fighting for survival, the Alieth (as they are known only to themselves) have reverted to a savage state. They aren't stupid; not by a long way, but a short and violent life doesn't lend itself to study and science. A sharpened stick is a pretty standard weapon.
There are far more Alieth than Teralaxians. A corruption of the genetics caused by the virus has led them to grow up and reproduce twice as fast as their taller oppresors.
But enough history! How does this story begin?

She knocked, then entered the office of Karla Cavenaugh and took a seat. "We really have to get an exterminator in," she said, "This place is infested! It's disgusting."
The older woman smiled thinly. "I agree, but you know how tight management is... 'Fraid you'll just have to step on them like everyone else."
Small talk over the women got down to business. There were two programmes which Donna can do research for.
The first is a series called 'Parallel Lives' about alternate lifestyles. Information is a bit sketchy on that, but at least it'll be varied.
The second is a series called 'Kink', which is about fetish sexuality and will (obviously go out in a late night slot. It doesn't pay any less, but it does sound a bit sleezy. Donna's girlfriend, Jeannie greeted her enthusiastically at the door of the small home they shared, but she understood that she would have to take a backseat tonight as Donna had work to do.

Donna seated herself at her computer and began to look into the subject of "crush". There were a lot of amateteur sites, but unless she decided to go for the human interest angle, those were best ignored.

Jeannie lounged on the bed behind Donna as she explored. "Hey Jean," she laughed, "You wouldn't believe this! People actually pay money to see women squashing bugs! Y'know, crickets, snails, sudobugs..."

"Yeah," asked Jeannie, smiling, "I wish you'd told me earlier... You wouldn't beLIEVE the number of sudes I found when I was cleaning out the garage. We couldda been rich!"

Donna thought about Sudobugs. She hated them, as most women did. They were insects who looked like a hideous parody of human appearance. It was really creepy seeing them scurry around...

Donna had two ideas for her first interview. One was an internet company called Katherine Krush which made and sold crush fetish videos. The other was rather a side angle: a biologist who claimed that sudobugs were intelligent! Either pathos or at least, comedy value there...

Donna arrived at the house of Doctor Polly Simms for her 10:30 appointment. As she rung the bell, she fought to suppress a smirk.

Inside, Polly ruffled her daughter's hair and went to greet her guest. Suzy, her eleven year old daughter was holding a plastic box containing a dozen little people. She seemed to be talking to them!

Polly showed in the researcher. "Would you mind leaving your shoes at the door?" she asked. Donna obliging slipped out of her mules and padded after her host into a study and sat down on a functional chair, as she took her seat at her PC.

"I'm sorry, I don't have more comfortable furniture in here..."

"S'okay," said Donna, politely. After they were settled with coffee, Donna clicked on her recorder and the interview started.

"so, you.... I mean, let's get this straight," she laughed awkwardly, "You actually claim that bugs are intelligent?"

Polly looked weary, as though tired of trying to explain. "Not BUGS, pseudofemipods."

"Sorry?"

"Commonly known as sudobugs," the doctor explained patiently.

"Right. So you think they're, what? as smart as say, mice?"

"NO! You aren't getting it at all. I'm saying that my research and personal experience have led me to the unarguable conclusion that they are nothing less than miniture human beings, as smart as you or I!"

"I'm sorry, excuse me," managed Donna, "Could I use your bathroom?"

"Of course, upstairs, first door on the left."

Donna managed to get back into the hall before she started giggling. At the top of the stairs, she realised that she'd forgotten which door she was supposed to go into!

14521.content:
-The 'Micro' economy crashes-
Read the news paper in the hands of Matt a rather adventurous young 'Micro' (you) hitching a ride to a 'Macro' city.
{For those who don't know micro=small while macro=large}

Because of the Micros government pushing for a leg up in the almost cold war with the much larger macro people, large investments fell to research and development. Unfortunately the invention of cold fusion came along ... Well in a way it was good; less smog, cheaper energy, more powerful/versatile gadgets, less reliance on oil (now virtually all oil can be sold to generate large funds thus adding to further progress of the Micro society since it's not needed as fuel any longer). Unfortunately this caused a ripple effect of destroying jobs around 'old energy' causing a major crash in the economy.

You were startled from your newspaper as the light train stopped at the border. You and many other desperate Micros were looking for jobs in the most terrifying land to your people. Although needed work you wouldn't consider yourself desperate, in fact you liked the idea of adventure in 'giantland', who knows maybe you'll even find a giant girl and fall in love. Stepping off the train you begin your new life.

The next day you awake in the god sized hotel room and head for your new job...
14521.title: Tiny that goes to bigland looking for opportunity

14521111.title: Yes

choices: She starts conversation to get aquainted
145211111.content:
After a barrage of questions about this new world enter Matt's mind {and the readers ...} You look around the room. It all seemed old fashioned to you, they still used wires to get energy to their devices for crying out loud. Every thing seemed bulky even considering everything was sky rise size to you, they must not be good at optimization... After letting out a large sigh settling your nerves you continued to leave for your new job. Everything was bigger than you expected, you knew these people were big, but big seemed like an understatement!

After crawling under the door since there was no way you were opening it you stood up in the hall. The Macro people who noticed you gave you dirty looks from the heavens. You knew full well the Macros didn't like the Micros, treating them like insects since ancient times. However you found comfort in the fact that it was illegal to kill you and this hotel was closely watched. Though even though the government itself tried creating peace, as soon as you left a closely watched area, no one would really care... Thank God your on the ground floor you think walking past the stairwell and into the lobby. You glanced at the people here, your new employer should be waiting here somewhere. Only one person has a school uniform, that's definitely her. She looked impatient looking at her yard sized phones clock. You glance at the wall clock realizing she's probably going to late for school, you'd better hurry.

"Hey, we could've met earlier if you didn't want to be late" you yelled looking up through her skirt, standing beside her intimidating white and pink shoe. It was a nice view you had to admit, resting on your suitcase you watched your new official titaness look down for the voice she heard. Making eye contact she smiled "Matt?" Her voice rang in your head a little. "Yup" you say as she lifts your suitcase into her purse, while you were deposited into her shirt pocket. "Well ready for your new job!?" she giggled, staring at the intimidating drop below you over her breast you replied "ready as I'm going to be". Don't worry I'm not gonna drop you or crush you or anything, your more fun while your alive" she winked realizing your insecurity at the very new and large changes to your life, before turning around unkowingly whipping her beasts and you around with the force of a rollercoaster. Luckily just lose your grip and fall into the deep pocket while she giggles, you found some comfort in her giddiness as she started walking...
Your world erupted with each step her breasts rising and falling knocking you like a ragdoll inside your 1st class cloth seat, you couldn't help but wonder in she noticed her pocket was turned into a bouncy castle. Finally stopping at a crosswalk, you right yourself and compose your spinning head . A massive object is lifed above you as she checks her phones clock before it fell out of your view from the bottom of the pocket. She glanced at her passenger still smiling, "you doing ok down there?", Head still spinning you responded with a thumbs up over exaggerated so she noticed the small movement. Looking more serious she stated a small (to her) decision, "If we don't wanna be late I'm gonna have to run, so hang on". Before even prossessing her words you suddenly find yourself weight less before the bottom of the pocket came to you, you doubted you even had time to fall much. Almost immediately your world lacked gravity as the air rushing overhead sounded like mountain winds ripping at the titaness' face.

Finally the trek was over (with 5 minutes to spare), but your world still spun and your head spun with the intensity of 1000 angry hornets (each one bigger than you are). Light enters the pocket as she pulls you out and sets you on the desk carefully laying you down and leaning in concern on her face. "What a rush!" You say panting vision slowly retuning, giggling her concern lifts from her face "good to hear sorry about that"

Just about the time you feel well enough to stand up all though carefully as you still feel sick and light headed ...
145211111.title: Schoolwork

choices: She goes directly to a place to eat
She needs to use the bathroom first
1452111111.content:
{sorry about titles up to this point guys I'm still new I forgot}

"Sooo I guess I should tell you my name..." She says as she watches you struggle to your feet. "Yeah my name's Matt..." You say knowing full well she knew your name already causing her to giggle. "My names Aphrodite" she states still looking down. "That's a weird name" you say somewhat confused "what kind of name is that?". She just giggled staring down at you "it's a macro name..." She states matter of fact, "to me your name is weird Matt" emphasizing your name and winking.

Just then the teacher walked in and started her job teaching, signaling that yours was soon to start helping Aphrodite with her schoolwork.

You couldn't believe how different the schools here were so different than your home, instead of the holographic desks which projected and project to work on, they still used pencil and paper!? Seeing the stacks upon stacks of paper needed and all the pencils on the desks all wonder why they cut so many trees down disappeared. Your people rarely cut any trees down due to their size but these giants could wrap their arms around most, so they needed significantly more wood just because of their gargantuan size, and even if you were the same size they'd still use more, judging by the sight before you.

The teacher Ms.Muse began attendance she called out a bunch of odd names (to you) like Jupiter and Zeus, finally calling Aphrodite and continuing to call out odd names such as Ra, Oden, Venus, Achilles, Thor and Anubis. You Were overwhelmed at this point at how far away you really were from home, an excitement brewed within you as you realized just how many unexpected things might happen on your adventure in this strange land.

Soon Class began reviewing geometry. All the measurements being in imperial instead of the metric you were used to confused you slightly but numbers are numbers.
-Question #1- Was written at the top of the page along with a picture of the front of some sort of house with measurements. printed neatly below was a series of tasks labeled as letters starting with a) find the area of the front of this house, remember to remove the area of the windows and doors.this task seemed easy to you, just 5 easy shapes. The look on Aphrodites face however was one of confusion. "Start by ignoring the 2 widows and the doors" you say pointing to the house. Glancing at the picture she just responded "how?" Sighing you realized why she needed a schoolwork assistant. After showing her to calculate the rectangular body and triangular roof of the house and adding the areas together, She calculated the rectangle on her own then hesitated. "What's wrong?" You asked having the next step already done in your head. "There's a missing measurement I can't calculate the triangle" she mumbled clearly frustrated, "math isn't your thing huh" you say somewhat knowing. She just sighed the giddiness of this morning replaced with a face looking like she died inside. "Well you can calculate the other measurements using Pythagorean theorem" you say trying to help the titaness leaning into her hand in boredom and frustration, after hearing you she sat up a slight spark in her eye "Oh I know that a²+b²=c² ('A' squared plus 'b' squared equals 'c' squared) right?" "Exactly though I prefer √(a²+b²)=c (the square root of 'A' squared plus 'b' squared equals 'c'" you say trying to make things easier for her, "that way you only have to put one equation through your calculator". Finally making headway you both fly through the rest taking a little more time on the last and hardest shape ... The circular attic window, but you eventually solve that one and began calculating the total surface area "so it has an area of 32" she said proudly "squared and in this measurement" you say not really knowing what the name of the measurement actually was "Oh so..." She said adding the characters after her answer writing 32H² "thirty two Hectares {not accurate to the real measurement system I just used what sounded cool} squared" she said "yes exactly" you say excitedly, before slumping over to her next words "question 'b)' next... " Luckily the bell rung and saved you both from the headache inducing math review.

Being careful while walking this time - since she realized how hard her walking was to you - she made her way to her next class English. Unlike math the giantess was better at the subject than you as she used punctuation and a vocabulary you'd never even heard of. You realized you fit nicely with her, your skill sets complimenting each other nicely... Mainly making you happy because you could never help her with her English work. Soon enough the bell rang again signaling lunch to begin...
1452111111.title: A big day of work, at school?..

154.content:
Time has gone by fast and mankind has developed. One of the major changes the earth made was the development of the shrinking technologie.

Julia Petroivka, a russian scientist developed it and gatherd a massive ammount of followers around her who believed in an all female patriarchy for a better future. The women did little terror attacks and took hostages to make money. As the shrinking technology was finished the group marched out, armed with shrinkguns and took over the world part by part. Nobody stood a chance against the women who downsized every resistance. People and equiptment was crushed like toys under the mercyless feet of the women.

After years of war they even succeed to shrink a complete city. Paris was the first City which was completly crushed underfoot.

Julia and her women won the war and ruled the world with the might of the shrink technologie which became a main piece of equiptment of the law forces. Jails and courts became unnessecary. Convicts simply was shrunk down.

This lead to the development of a new race. The Outlaws. The shrunken people of course tried to hide and to survive even though their miserable situation. As soon as they are shrunk they simply lose all their rights. The outlaws gather and build villages and cities and have their own culture and civilisation.

To the normal sized people the outlaws are convicts and lawless people who don't even deserve to live and so they are treated. An outlaw that is a slave to a normal one is lucky because he is still alive.
154.title: When women ruled the world

1542.content:
Jerrad was 14 and wasn't an acctual outlaw, his Grandfather was, or had been. He had spat in the street just as a policeman came around the corner. he had been put on trial and been shrunk. But that's all ancient history, 2007 to be exact, people hadn't realised just how much trouble it was possible to get in to.

Jerrad live in the City of Bob (the original inhabitants had been Yobs until they took their conviction seriously.).
He could never understand why Giants were so harsh, over half the people here were completely innocents.

One day he saw a Giantess walking towards the City he acted quickley and went to the very top of the barrier wall and when she was in hearing distance he shouted
'What do you want with us we are not your playthings!'
she looked at him for a fue seconds, a shocked expresion on her face. She grabbed him.
The other Bobians started protesting and shouting.
The Giant took Jerrard to the Giants Forest and sat down in a clearing, she place Jerrard infront of her. They starred at each other.
Both could hear the people chanting,
'When we see a Cannibal we shall Kill it! So don't come back (some people just aren't very imaginative)

'I'm not a cannibal' she said to Jerrard 'It's inhuman.'

They both had a long conversation and Jerrard said farewell.
When he got back to his City he told everyone what had happened, no one believed him and thought that he was just being modest.

The next day he snuck out and went back to the clearing, she was there. He went back the day after that, and the day after that, and the days after that. Jerrard began to see her as less than a Beast and more as a 16 year old Human.

One day he came back, but she was criing. 'My boyfriend dumped me,' she explained.
Jerrard felt sorry for her
'I'll be your boyfriend then, if you like!'
she smiled.
Jerrard snugled down next to her thigh,
'So, what do you want to do now, as Boyfriend and Girlfriend?
She smiled again and picked him up.
1542.title: The Giantess

15421.content:
" Well, we could go on a date." said Cindy( thats the giantess' name). " What are going to do?" said Jerrard.

" Well, obviously we can't do normal things. Your so small compared to me. I could accidentally hurt if I kissed you too hard." said Cindy.


" We can talk and maybe we can have some dinner." said Jerrard. " That sounds good" said Cindy.

" Well, how about Friday night at 7?" said Jerrard. " Alright. We'll meet here then." said Cindy.

info.brief_description: Very Tiny people live amongst normal People.
info.description:
In a Galaxy, Far, Far away from ours, there is a planet where nature has also spread the seed of life. It has the same flora and Fauna as we have, or mostly the same.

There are two different kinds of humans. The headrace, are just as we are.

The second Human race is about 72x times smaller than us which makes them about 1 inch.

Normally the normal sized people don´t really give a shit about the small ones. They are treated like vermin. Poor people use them as food.

In a more modern time they possibly could have some diplomatic or some business relationships.
